messages.content: I missed this earlier. We will push to red (goal is Friday) and test as fast as possible. Will you all be able to test too? We'll need to test all apps + Load List + FULFILL. If we can build confidence with the testing, we can work to release before March 2nd.

Yep, I talked with the dev team and we found the issue. The station dropdown is currently only rendering the first 10 stations.

 

It should be a pretty easy fix. We’re going to increase that limit (likely to 1000) so you shouldn’t ever run into this again.

 

Are you okay if we include this in the next scheduled update on March 2nd? There’s no issue with the data itself, it’s just the dropdown display limit. If this is causing a bigger problem, let me know and we can prioritize it sooner.
In restock I can see, 19,23,32,33,34,42,49,54,61,65 In NAV, I am assigned to nearly all stations and have been for years. No issue seeing everything in Material app
^Red and Stage are also updated to show the correct values as well.
Leigh We just pushed a fix for this in Prod. Can you all please let me know how it looks when you get a chance?

Caitlyn, on this, is it happening for a specific set of stations, or a specific number that you can see?

 

We’re looking into it, and we’re wondering if it could be a rendering issue. Since you’re assigned to so many stations, the dropdown may only be showing a portion of them.
Okay sounds good, I'll take all this to the team, thanks.
FYI - Caitlyn is sending out a communication to stations to tell them to hold off on using Restock so you guys can get these issues resolved and we can test for a couple of days
Okay gotcha, so for each item there, it is double the correct value in NAV?
this is a snippet of some of the items
not every single item but more than a "few"
Okay, and it is duplicating in Restock for every item that you've validated or just a select few?
this is what is in NAV. Restock has double this qty. Validated on a couple of items

Document No. Item No. Description Shipment Date Qty. in Transit Outstanding Quantity Unit of Measure Container Qty. Transfer-from Code Transfer-to Code
T0681495 114880 Kale-Curly 2/17/2026 0. 90. Each 15 010 010_0000
T0681496 114880 Kale-Curly 2/17/2026 0. 90. Each 15 010 010_0001

T0681501 114880 Kale-Curly 2/17/2026 0. 60. Each 10 010 010_0005
T0681502 114880 Kale-Curly 2/17/2026 0. 12. Each 2 010 010_0006
T0681502 114880 Kale-Curly 2/17/2026 0. 42. Each 7 010 010_0006
T0681503 114880 Kale-Curly 2/17/2026 0. 48. Each 8 010 010_0008
Item 114880 - Station 010 in Production is an example
Chris Caitlyn is good with rolling the station dropdown fix on the March 2nd release! Will create the task.

The issue is in LoadList.tsx:100. The erpLoadListUsers query supports pagination (first, after params), but the call doesn't pass a first value:                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
 getUsers({ where: { email: { eq: userEmail }, status: { eq: ErpLoadListUserStatus.Active } } });                                                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
 The erpLoadListUsers GraphQL query is cursor-paginated:                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
 query GetErpLoadListUsers($where: ..., $first: Int, $after: String) {                                                                                                                                             
     erpLoadListUsers(where: $where, ..., first: $first, after: $after) {                                                                                                                                          
         nodes { ... }                              
         totalCount
     }
 }

 Since no first is specified, the server applies its default page size (typically 10 in HotChocolate). Each user-station assignment is a separate erpLoadListUser record, so a user with 83 stations has 83 records,
  but only the first page (likely 10) is returned. That subset then gets mapped to userStations at line 159:

 const stationCodes = sites.map(s => s.site).filter((site): site is string => !!site);

 The fix would be to pass a first value large enough to cover all of a user's station assignments. For example, at LoadList.tsx:100:

 getUsers({
     first: 200,
     where: { email: { eq: userEmail }, status: { eq: ErpLoadListUserStatus.Active } }
 });
no, we're fine, we're going to roll a fix for this by updating the view
Please let me know outcome of this. and let me know if i need to join
If you want to I can yes

Station 010

 

Item 114880 - in Production is specific example
Yeah, she said she is mapped to all stations in NAV.
actually, in wsapi, I show her mapped to lots more stations
Also, just so everyone is aware:

Also, from Leigh: 

 

She said in RESTOCK, for a lot of items, NOT every item, they are doubled up from what she sees in NAV.

 

She sent this screenshot of Load Lists, and said it's true for all of the red columns in this specific screenshot:

I asked her if it is an exact doubling up, and she said yes, for all the red ones there. 

 

So somehow, we must be duplicating that value.
um, Scott, did we introduce that somehow? I show Caitlyn has 8 stations assigned to her in wsapi

Yeah it was Caitlyn that was looking to use it, but she can't see it when she is trying to access it. 

 

When a user is assigned to more than one station in NAV, they get the dropdown to select what station they are specifically using, and she's not seeing it there.
